title: NumPy: Basic Statistics
story: NumPy provides fast statistical functions. Learn to calculate mean, standard deviation, min, and max efficiently.
instructions: Create array [12, 15, 18, 22, 25, 28]. Calculate and print the mean (average) on line 1, then standard deviation on line 2.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

# Calculate statistics
data = np.array([12, 15, 18, 22, 25, 28])
mean_val = data.mean()
std_val = data.std()
print(mean_val)
print(std_val)
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np

data = np.array([12, 15, 18, 22, 25, 28])
mean_val = data.mean()
std_val = data.std()
print(mean_val)
print(std_val)

hints.text: Use .mean() and .std() methods on the array.
Mean is sum/count. Std measures spread around the mean.
